title: Seriously Asian: Amaranth Greens
summary: Need a gluten free, whole 30, and vegan side dish? Seriously Asian: Amaranth Greens could be a spectacular recipe to try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 3g of protein, 42g of fat, and a total of 417 calories. For $2.32 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 1. If you have amaranth greens, very garlic, very garlic, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 33 people were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. A few people really liked this Southern dish. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 49%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Baby Greens Salad With Asparagus, Sweet Amaranth & Green Garlic, amaranth yogurt parfait â€“ popped amaranth parfait with fruits, and Cucumber Asian Greens.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. You could try Hugel Gewurztraminer Jubilee. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 44 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Hugel Gewurztraminer Jubilee
productMatches.description: Hugel's "Jubilee" are sourced exclusively from family owned Grand Cru vineyards in the top terroirs in Alsace. Great classic Gewurztraminer which will gain in complexity and spiciness for 8 years or more. Its suave and long complex aftertaste will make it the ideal partner to strong cheeses and spicy dishes.
